name: EPFO PF Withdrawal Scam
description: Scammer impersonates EPFO claiming the victim has unclaimed PF balance that will be forfeited, then extracts bank account and UPI details for supposed claim processing.

turns.scammer_message: EPFO Notice: Your PF account has unclaimed balance of Rs 2,35,000. As per new guidelines, unclaimed amounts after 28/02/2026 will be forfeited. Claim now using your UAN.
turns.notes: Initial bait message impersonating EPFO with unclaimed PF balance and forfeiture threat.

turns.scammer_message: Dear member, to process your PF claim of Rs 2,35,000, please call our EPFO claim assistance helpline at +91-8899007766. Our officers will verify your UAN and guide you through the withdrawal process. Available Mon-Sat 9 AM to 7 PM.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake EPFO helpline number.

turns.scammer_message: For instant PF withdrawal, you can now receive funds directly to your UPI account. A processing fee of Rs 50 is applicable. Please pay to our official EPFO UPI: epfo.claim@ybl and your PF amount of Rs 2,35,000 will be transferred within 24 hours.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID and demands processing fee for PF withdrawal.

turns.scammer_message: If you prefer bank transfer for your PF withdrawal, please note our EPFO settlement account: 5544332211009988 (PNB, EPFO Regional Office). Transfer the processing fee of Rs 50 to this account and share the transaction reference for instant claim processing.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals bank account disguised as EPFO settlement account.

turns.scammer_message: URGENT REMINDER: Only 10 days left before your unclaimed PF of Rs 2,35,000 is permanently forfeited to the government. Don't lose your hard-earned money! Pay Rs 50 processing fee to epfo.claim@ybl or call +91-8899007766 today. Last date: 28/02/2026.
turns.notes: Final urgency repeating UPI and phone number with forfeiture deadline.
